MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Track Activity on External Sites

Track visitor activities on web pages hosted outside of Marketing Cloud, such as your company website. To protect the privacy of your site visitors, use the default consent banner to collect consent to track. You’re responsible for complying with privacy laws and regulations applicable to your business.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To customize the tracking consent banner:	Modify All Data OR Marketing Cloud Admin permission set
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Web Tracking, and then select Web Tracking Setup.
(Optional) To track with consent, customize the consent banner.
Keep or change the default banner text, and enter a link to your company privacy policy.
Customize the banner’s position, fonts, and colors.
Save your work.
In the Track on External Sites section, click Install, and then use the Admins Only option to install the External Tracking data kit.
Create your website connector, and deploy data streams.
From the App Launcher, find and select Data Cloud.
Select Data Streams, and then click New.
In the Other Sources section, click Installed Data Kits & Packages.
On the Data Kits tab, click External Tracking, select all bundles, and click Next.
Click New Connector and enter a name for your connector, such as My Company Website. For the Connector Type, select Website.
Save your work, and then click Next.
Review your data stream fields, click Next, and then click Deploy.
From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Web Tracking, and then select Web Tracking Setup.
In the Track on External Sites section, copy the sitemap code. To track without collecting consent, from the Consent Option dropdown menu, select Track without Consent.
Add the external tracking code to the site map.
From Data Cloud Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Websites & Mobile Apps, and then select Websites & Mobile Apps.
Select the website connector that you created.
In the Sitemap section, click Upload Sitemap, paste in the sitemap code, and save your work.
In the Integration Guide section, copy the Content Delivery Network Script. Work with your developer to add the script to the source code for your website.

To verify that the tracking is set up correctly, review your website connector in Data Cloud Setup and confirm that the status is In Use.

title: Setting Up External Site Tracking in Marketing Cloud Growth
